name: Salmon with Vegetables
description: Sheet pan salmon and seasonal vegetables. Healthy, practical, and elegant one-pan meal.

instructions.instruction: Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Line large baking sheet with parchment paper.
Make marinade: In small bowl, combine 2 tbsp olive oil, juice of 1 lemon, honey, mustard, and half the garlic.
Place salmon in center of sheet. Brush with half the marinade.
instructions.tip: If skin-on, place skin side down.

instructions.instruction: Place all vegetables in large bowl.
Add remaining olive oil, garlic, salt, and pepper to vegetables. Toss to coat.
instructions.tip: All vegetables should be coated with oil.

instructions.instruction: Arrange vegetables around salmon in single layer.
instructions.tip: Vegetables shouldn't overlap - they'll steam instead of roast.

instructions.instruction: Slice remaining lemon and place on top of salmon.

instructions.tip: Salmon internal temp should reach 145°F. Center can be slightly pink.

instructions.instruction: Check if vegetables are roasted. If needed, add 5 more minutes.
Remove from oven. Drizzle remaining marinade over hot salmon.
Squeeze remaining lemon juice over vegetables.
Sprinkle fresh dill and serve immediately.
instructions.tip: Use pan juices too - flavor gold!

tips: Salmon is one of the richest sources of omega-3 fatty acids.
Sheet pan dinner - easy one-pan cooking.
Cut vegetables to similar sizes for even cooking.
If using frozen salmon, thaw completely first.
storageInfo: Refrigerate 2 days. Salmon is best fresh.
servingSuggestion: Complete meal on its own. Add quinoa or brown rice if desired.
variations: Mediterranean: Add olives, capers, and sun-dried tomatoes.
Asian style: Use teriyaki sauce and sesame seeds.
Winter version: Use butternut squash and Brussels sprouts.
